text: Sir Eric Grant Yarrow, 3rd Baronet, MBE, DL, FRSE (23 April 1920 - 22 September 2018) was a British businessman. He was born in Surrey, England. After serving during World War II, he worked at Yarrow Shipbuilders, in 1946, later becoming President of Yarrow plc until 1987, and was Chairman of Clydesdale Bank from 1985 to 1991. Yarrow was appointed a Vice-President of RINA in 1972 as well as serving as Prime Warden of the Shipwrights' Company (1970â€“71), among other charitable activities. Yarrow was appointed Member of the Order of the British Empire (MBE) for military service in 1946.
